awd_titl_txt: Research Initiation:  The Neutrophil Model for Growth FactorSignalling
awd_abstract_narration: RESEARCH INITIATION AWARD:                                                                                                                           THE NEUTROPHIL MODEL FOR GROWTH FACTOR SIGNALLING                                                                                                                                   ABSTRACT                                                                                                                            Understanding mechanisms of surface receptor signal generation,                 signal transduction via intracellular messengers, and coupling of               intracellular messengers to cell functional responses is an area                of intensive experimental research.  The central goal of the                    proposed research is to incorporate current knowledge of the above              processes for a mammalian cell sensory system, the                              polymorphonuclear neutrophil (PMN), into structured mathematical                models of receptor-mediated cell responses.  This research will                 improve understanding of the interrelationships of biochemical and              biophysical events in stimulus-response coupling which are often                investigated individually but seldom considered collectively.
org_div_long_name: Division of Chemical, Bioengineering, Environmental, and Transport Systems

inst.org_lgl_bus_name: REGENTS OF THE UNIVERSITY OF MINNESOTA
